---
title: "Presentation Title"
author: "Your Name"
date: "`r Sys.Date()`"
output:
  rmdNMU::html_slides:
    # Choose your faculty theme:
    # humanities, education, business, sciences,
    # health, engineering, law, ocean
    faculty: "sciences"
    # Code highlighting style
    highlight: "tango"
    # Additional reveal.js options
    reveal_options:
      slideNumber: true
      hash: true
      controls: true
---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  echo = TRUE,          # Show code
  warning = FALSE,      # Hide warnings
  message = FALSE,      # Hide messages
  fig.width = 8,        # Figure width
  fig.height = 5,       # Figure height
  fig.align = 'center', # Center figures
  out.width = '80%'     # Output width
)
```

# Introduction {data-background-color="#f7f7f7"}

## Welcome

- This is a template for NMU-styled presentations
- It uses reveal.js for modern HTML slides
- Features faculty-specific color themes
- Includes the NMU logo on all slides

## Code Example

```{r}
# Example R code
data <- data.frame(
  x = 1:10,
  y = rnorm(10)
)
head(data)
```

## Plot Example

```{r}
plot(data$x, data$y, 
     type = "b",
     main = "Sample Plot",
     xlab = "X values",
     ylab = "Y values")
```

## Mathematical Content

You can include equations:

$$
\bar{x} = \frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^n x_i
$$

## Tables

Create formatted tables:

```{r}
knitr::kable(head(mtcars[,1:4]))
```
